intro: Lasiococcus orocola, commonly known as the woolly leaf shrub, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which are followed by small, round berries. Lasiococcus orocola thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
